dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 1289 IH: John Muir National Historic Site Expansion Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. DeSaulnier introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To authorize the Secretary of the Interior to acquire approximately 44 acres of land in Martinez, California, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the John Muir National Historic Site Expansion Act.

section.header: John Muir National Historic Site land acquisition

subsection.text: The Secretary of the Interior may acquire by donation the approximately 44 acres of land, and interests in such land, that are identified on the map entitled John Muir National Historic Site Proposed Boundary Expansion, numbered 426/127150, and dated November, 2014.

Upon the acquisition of the land authorized by subsection (a), the Secretary of the Interior shall adjust the boundaries of the John Muir Historic Site in Martinez, California, to include the land identified on the map referred to in subsection (a).

The land and interests in land acquired under subsection (a) shall be administered as part of the John Muir National Historic Site established by the Act of August 31, 1964 (Public Law 88â€“547; 78 Stat. 753; 16 U.S.C. 461 note).
The authority provided in subsections (a), (b), and (c) shall apply only if the lands described in subsection (a) are held in title by the Muir Heritage Land Trust by August 31, 2015.
